abstract: Citadel Investment Group founder Kenneth Griffin is just one of the many hedge-fund managers that must recoup their losses before skimming fees from their profits again, a process that could take years.
snippet: Citadel Investment Group founder Kenneth Griffin is just one of the many hedge-fund managers that must recoup their losses before skimming fees from their profits again, a process that could take years.
lead_paragraph: Less than six months ago, Kenneth C. Griffin and his wife, Anne — both wealthy hedge fund managers in their 30s — hired a Ph.D. student in economics to help dole out their money to charities.

headline.main: Leaner Days Ahead for Citadel and Other Funds
